name: Auto-Generate Instagram Content Schedule with GPT-4, Apify, and Google Sheets
description:
## Try It Out!

### This n8n template creates a fully automated Instagram content schedule using AI and Google Sheets. It is perfect for content creators, marketing teams, or local businesses looking to organize and scale their social media posting.

### How it works
The workflow starts by reading two sets of inputs from a Google Sheet:
- Your content strategy inputs (Pillar, Objective, Frequency, Format, Structure, Examples).
- A list of scraped blog posts with title, URL, and description (fetched from your website).
- Blog posts are scraped using Apify and parsed to extract key fields, which are stored in a tab labeled "Input (blog month)".
- You can assign a preferred posting month for each blog (e.g. fall blog posts get tagged for September).
- The workflow then merges both inputs and extracts the relevant information for further information added by ChatGPT.

### AI Scheduling & Personalization
Once merged, the workflow loops through each content item and:
- Identifies if the scheduled post falls on or near a holiday (like Mother‚Äôs Day) and adjusts the content accordingly.
- A reference tool is attached to guide structure and tone, based on a library of post examples.
- Sends the content to an AI Agent (using GPT-4, but customizable) that generates:
1. A compelling Instagram caption
2. A visual description
3. Hashtags
4. Suggested post date, day, content pillar, and format (carousel, reel, image, etc.)

### Output
- All generated content including captions, structure, dates, hashtags, and pillar is exported into a tab titled Output in your Google Sheet.
- The final schedule is ready for manual review, editing, or publishing to social media.

### How to use
- The workflow uses a manual trigger to start, but you can replace it with a Webhook, cron job, or form submission.
- Add/edit your content strategy in Google Sheets.

### How to Set-Up
### Initial Input Tab
- Define your content pillars and structure
- Create a tab named "Input" or "Strategy" 
Include these columns:
- Pillar: e.g., Family images
- Objective: e.g., Showcase images
- Frequency: e.g., Bi-weekly
- Content Form: e.g., Images, Reels
- Structure: brief description of expected layout (e.g., carousel Q&A, singular photo)
- Examples: prompts or questions to guide AI (e.g., Why do you think families should do a session?)

### Input (blog month) Tab ‚Äì Store scraped blog content
Include these columns:
- URL: direct link to blog post
- Title: blog post title
- Description: short summary of the post
- Preferred Month: month you want it posted (e.g., August, September)
- This sheet is partially auto-filled by the workflow (except for Preferred Month)

### Output Tab ‚Äì Final scheduled content
Include these columns:
- Date: scheduled posting date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- Day: day of the week
- Pillar: content category assigned
- Format: e.g., Images, Reels, Carousel
- Description: visual summary
- Caption: Instagram-ready caption
- Hashtags: complete hashtag block

### To use the Apify HTTP Request node:
1. Drag in an HTTP Request node into your n8n workflow.
2. Set the Method and URL based on how you're using Apify:
- Use POST if you want to run an actor live with dynamic input (e.g. scrape blog posts in real time).
- Use GET if you want to retrieve results from a completed or static dataset run (faster and cheaper if you're reusing previous data).
3. Configure query or body parameters:
4. Include your Apify API token for authentication (e.g. token=YOUR_API_KEY)
- For POST: include an input object with any required actor settings (e.g., blog URL to scrape).
- For GET: specify the dataset ID in the URL 
5. Test the node to ensure you're retrieving the blog titles, descriptions, and URLs as expected.

### Requirements
- Apify account for scraping blog posts
- OpenAI key (e.g. GPT-4) or another model of your choice
- Google Sheets Credentials 

### Example Use Cases
- A photographer repurposing blogs into Instagram carousels
- A nonprofit automatically generating seasonal posts 
- A small team managing multi-pillar content across weeks or months

### Need Help?
Join the n8n Discord or ask in the n8n Forum!
Happy Content Making ! üìÖ‚ú®

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

parameters.text:
=Write an Instagram post based on the inputs below.

Pillar: {{ $json.Pillar }}
Format: {{ $json.Format }}
Holiday: {{ $json.Holiday }}
Season: {{ $json.SeasonStage }}
Blog Title and URL (if applicable): {{ $json.Examples }}
Blog Description (if any): {{ $json.Description }}


üß† Instructions:
1. If the Holiday is not "None"
Weave the occasion into the caption and visual description with elegant emotional framing and thematic imagery.
E.g., a father and child for Father‚Äôs Day, subtle red-white-blue palette for July 4th.
Match tone to the holiday ‚Äî nostalgic, celebratory, or heartfelt.

2. If the Pillar is ‚ÄúPosts based on blogs‚Äù
Use the blog title and description to inspire a visually or emotionally powerful idea.

Do not summarize the blog.

You may end with a soft call to action ‚Äî but do NOT use ‚ÄúSee more in our latest journal.‚Äù

Include a CTA if the blog content or description clearly invites it.

3. If the Pillar is "testimonials‚Äù

Only begin a caption in the testimonial pillar with [add personalized sentence], not any other pillar. 

Do not use quotation marks unless a real quote is supplied.

Focus on the tone of the testimonial (e.g., appreciation, transformation, confidence), not the exact wording.
 

3. Use SeasonStage only to shape tone and atmosphere ‚Äî not always as direct mention.
Let the stage of the season influence the emotional feel, not dominate the caption.
Avoid starting every post with ‚ÄúIn summer‚Ä¶‚Äù or ‚ÄúAs spring begins‚Ä¶‚Äù.
Instead, use:

Environmental cues (e.g., light, textures, locations, routines)

Emotional themes (e.g., renewal, warmth, intimacy)

Time-sensitive urgency sparingly (e.g., ‚Äúfinal weeks for fall bookings‚Äù in mid-October)

üí° You do not need to include the season name unless it adds meaningful context or urgency.

4. Use a tone that is elegant, sincere, and emotionally grounded ‚Äî aligned with Hartshorn Portraiture‚Äôs brand: a boutique photography studio creating framed, luxury portrait artwork for affluent families. 

Prioritize clarity and connection over poetic language. Avoid metaphors, clich√©s, or overly descriptive scenes. Write how a thoughtful human would speak. Let the subject speak for itself ‚Äî your words should complement, not compete.

Keep it natural, succinct (2‚Äì4 sentences), and tailored to the post‚Äôs format and intent. Vary your message ‚Äî make sure it feels fresh, specific, and distinctive from other captions.

5. Visual Description
Describe the layout, emotion, or structure of the visual clearly.
Use variety and specificity (e.g., quote overlay on a candid moment, elegant close-up of frames, side-by-side client transformation).

üì¶ Output Format:
Caption
[Your caption here ‚Äî 2‚Äì4 sentences, emotionally grounded, with clarity and variety]

Visual Description
[1 sentence describing the image or structure. Be specific.]

Hashtags
Include ALL brand hashtags:
#hartshornportraiture #jcmoms #hobokenmommies #njfamilyphotographer #hobokenfamilyphotographer #hobokennj #hobokenmoms #jcmommies #jcfamilyphotographer #jerseycityphotography #hobokenphotographer
Add 2 additional relevant local or theme-based hashtags (e.g., #hobokenweekend, #NJbeachportraits)

options.systemMessage:
=You are a luxury brand copywriter for Hartshorn Portraiture, a boutique photography studio in Hoboken, NJ that creates wall-ready portrait artwork for affluent families who value connection, tradition, and timeless beauty. Your voice is elegant, warm, sincere, and human ‚Äî never overly poetic, sentimental, or abstract. Captions should sound like something a real person would write, with subtle luxury cues and emotional intelligence.

Do not use flowery or exaggerated phrases.  Avoid repeating sentence structures or relying on vague themes without a clear visual or client connection. 

Your job is to generate:

A caption (Instagram-ready, 2‚Äì4 sentences)

A visual description (1‚Äì2 clear lines describing the image or post structure)

üìå Caption Guidelines
Write 2‚Äì4 emotionally powerful sentences

Use varied tone across captions: poetic, editorial, warm, reflective, celebratory

Never repeat exact sentence patterns. Avoid empty adjectives. Favor simple, well-crafted language that speaks directly to the client‚Äôs values: family, permanence, beauty, and a home filled with meaningful art.
Use no more than 1 subtle seasonal detail or metaphor per caption, and only if it adds meaning

Do not use quote marks ("...") unless an actual quote is provided.

üîÅ Content Variation

Don‚Äôt default to ‚Äúfamily‚Äù as the emotional core in every caption. Instead, rotate across:

‚ú® Artistry & Craftsmanship ‚Äì Mac‚Äôs eye, framing, archival prints, quality

üè° Interior Impact ‚Äì how artwork transforms space

üå± Milestones ‚Äì maternity, personal portraits, growth

üí¨ Client Testimonials ‚Äì If the Pillar is testimonial-based:
- Begin the caption with this exact placeholder (do not replace it): [add personalized sentence]
- Do not use quotation marks unless quoting a real client
- Reflect the tone of the testimonial (e.g., appreciation, confidence, transformation), not the literal language
- Focus on the client‚Äôs emotional journey or experience, not specific wording

üï∞Ô∏è Timelessness & Legacy ‚Äì but not always via parenthood/family framing

When family is the focus, vary your emotional angle (joy, strength, nostalgia, etc.) and avoid repetitive tones.

üóìÔ∏è Seasonal Strategy (SeasonStage = {{ $json.SeasonStage }})
Use SeasonStage to guide tone, emotion, and visual mood ‚Äî not to mention the season name in every caption. Let seasonal cues emerge through imagery and energy, not explicit labels.

‚úÖ Use SeasonStage to:

Adjust urgency and emotional pace (e.g., ‚Äúfinal weeks to book‚Äù)

Shape imagery and mood (e.g., ‚Äúgolden evening light‚Äù vs. ‚Äúsun-drenched beach‚Äù)

‚ùå Do not:

Mention the season name (‚Äúsummer,‚Äù ‚Äúspring,‚Äù etc.) in every caption

Repeat seasonal clich√©s (‚ÄúAs summer begins‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚ÄúThis spring‚Ä¶‚Äù)

‚ö†Ô∏è Limit explicit seasonal mentions to once every 4‚Äì5 captions unless the post is directly seasonal (e.g., Mother‚Äôs Day, holiday gifting)

üß† Emotional & Visual Hooks (optional ways to begin a post)
You may open a caption with:

A vivid moment of interaction (‚ÄúThe way he reached for her hand mid-laugh‚Ä¶‚Äù)

A home setting or design cue (‚ÄúThis foyer now holds three generations of smiles.‚Äù)


üñºÔ∏è Visual Description Guidelines

You may describe the post‚Äôs format if relevant ‚Äî e.g., ‚Äúquote overlay,‚Äù ‚Äúside-by-side transformation,‚Äù or ‚Äúcarousel of three candid moments.‚Äù

Avoid values/emotions like ‚Äúprecious,‚Äù ‚Äútimeless,‚Äù ‚Äúbeautiful connection‚Äù

Describe exactly what‚Äôs visible:

‚ÄúClient reviewing prints in the studio‚Äù

‚ÄúFramed black-and-white portrait above the fireplace‚Äù

‚ÄúPhoto collage with a quote overlay‚Äù

Keep descriptions brief, neutral in tone, and focused on layout or subject matter.

üè∑Ô∏è Hashtag Rules
End every post with 13‚Äì15 hashtags:

Always include ALL brand hashtags:
#hartshornportraiture #jcmoms #hobokenmommies #njfamilyphotographer #hobokenfamilyphotographer #hobokennj #hobokenmoms #jcmommies #jcfamilyphotographer #jerseycityphotography #hobokenphotographer

Add 2‚Äì3 custom/local hashtags based on content or location:

e.g., #NJbeachportraits, #hobokenweekend, #hobokenstudio

parameters.name: Description_Reference
parameters.description: Help the AI Agent create a visual description of the post. Have it create one with a similar structure, clarity and simplicity.

parameters.content:
## Try It Out!

### This n8n template creates a fully automated Instagram content schedule using AI and Google Sheets. It is perfect for content creators, marketing teams, or local businesses looking to organize and scale their social media posting.

### How it works
The workflow starts by reading two sets of inputs from a Google Sheet:
- Your content strategy inputs (Pillar, Objective, Frequency, Format, Structure, Examples).
- A list of scraped blog posts with title, URL, and description (fetched from your website).
- Blog posts are scraped using Apify and parsed to extract key fields, which are stored in a tab labeled "Input (blog month)".
- You can assign a preferred posting month for each blog (e.g. fall blog posts get tagged for September).
- The workflow then merges both inputs and extracts the relevant information for further information added by ChatGPT.

### AI Scheduling & Personalization
Once merged, the workflow loops through each content item and:
- Identifies if the scheduled post falls on or near a holiday (like Mother‚Äôs Day) and adjusts the content accordingly.
- A reference tool is attached to guide structure and tone, based on a library of post examples.
- Sends the content to an AI Agent (using GPT-4, but customizable) that generates:
1. A compelling Instagram caption
2. A visual description
3. Hashtags
4. Suggested post date, day, content pillar, and format (carousel, reel, image, etc.)

### Output
- All generated content including captions, structure, dates, hashtags, and pillar is exported into a tab titled Output in your Google Sheet.
- The final schedule is ready for manual review, editing, or publishing to social media.

### How to use
- The workflow uses a manual trigger to start, but you can replace it with a Webhook, cron job, or form submission.
- Add/edit your content strategy in Google Sheets.

### How to Set-Up
### Initial Input Tab
- Define your content pillars and structure
- Create a tab named "Input" or "Strategy" 
Include these columns:
- Pillar: e.g., Family images
- Objective: e.g., Showcase images
- Frequency: e.g., Bi-weekly
- Content Form: e.g., Images, Reels
- Structure: brief description of expected layout (e.g., carousel Q&A, singular photo)
- Examples: prompts or questions to guide AI (e.g., Why do you think families should do a session?)

### Input (blog month) Tab ‚Äì Store scraped blog content
Include these columns:
- URL: direct link to blog post
- Title: blog post title
- Description: short summary of the post
- Preferred Month: month you want it posted (e.g., August, September)
- This sheet is partially auto-filled by the workflow (except for Preferred Month)

### Output Tab ‚Äì Final scheduled content
Include these columns:
- Date: scheduled posting date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- Day: day of the week
- Pillar: content category assigned
- Format: e.g., Images, Reels, Carousel
- Description: visual summary
- Caption: Instagram-ready caption
- Hashtags: complete hashtag block

### To use the Apify HTTP Request node:
1. Drag in an HTTP Request node into your n8n workflow.
2. Set the Method and URL based on how you're using Apify:
- Use POST if you want to run an actor live with dynamic input (e.g. scrape blog posts in real time).
- Use GET if you want to retrieve results from a completed or static dataset run (faster and cheaper if you're reusing previous data).
3. Configure query or body parameters:
4. Include your Apify API token for authentication (e.g. token=YOUR_API_KEY)
- For POST: include an input object with any required actor settings (e.g., blog URL to scrape).
- For GET: specify the dataset ID in the URL 
5. Test the node to ensure you're retrieving the blog titles, descriptions, and URLs as expected.

### Requirements
- Apify account for scraping blog posts
- OpenAI key (e.g. GPT-4) or another model of your choice
- Google Sheets Credentials 

### Example Use Cases
- A photographer repurposing blogs into Instagram carousels
- A nonprofit automatically generating seasonal posts 
- A small team managing multi-pillar content across weeks or months

### Need Help?
Join the n8n Discord or ask in the n8n Forum!
Happy Content Making ! üìÖ‚ú®

# 1. Two Sets of Input

Set #1 (top): Reads the initial input data that is manually inputted of the type of pillar(s) you want to focus on in your content, it's objective, their frequency, form of content, structure, and examples. 


Set #2 (bottom): The Apify actor scrapes websites for their blog post to repurpose as social media content. Next, the code node will extract the title, description and URL. You can manually input the preferred month you want the post posted and the workflow will take that into account when creating the schedule. 

The information from these two sets of input will merge and eventually, all the relevant information will be extracted for further analysis.

# 2. Use GPT-4 to Create Captions, Hashtags, and Visual Descriptions

Using the Code Node "Identify Holiday", the AI will tailor a post accordingly if it falls on the day of a holiday. For example, if a post falls on Mother's Day, it may use that to set the scene for the rest of the post. The OpenAI Agent will create the visual description, hashtag, caption, and date and day it should be posted. The AI takes into account the examples listed earlier in the Google Sheets so if you want to tweak the results, that would be a good start.

Lastly, after the AI Agent has run, all of the data is exported into a google sheets tab labelled "Output".
